H0.text: when was the reaper invented by cyrus mccormick. 1830

H2.text: when was the reaper invented by cyrus mccormick. 1825

H3.text: when was the reaper invented by cyrus mccormick. 1837

A4.text: The young McCormick was granted a patent on the reaper on June 21, 1834, two years after having been granted a patent for a self-sharpening plow.

A6.text: Cyrus McCormick claimed that his reaper was actually invented in 1831, giving him the true claim to the general design of the machine.

A7.text: The film covers the invention and evolution of the reaper from 1831 to the 1930s.

A8.text: By 1831 his son Cyrus H. McCormick took over; he obtained the first of many patents in 1834.

A9.text: The McCormick Reaper was first designed by Robert McCormick in Virginia in the 1820s.
